text: Mohamed Hassine Hatem Mersal (born 20 January 1975)https://www.worldathletics.org/athletes/egypt/hatem-mohamed- mersal-14167487 is an Egyptian former long jumper. His personal best jump is 8.31 metres, achieved in June 1999 in Oslo. This is the current national record.Egyptian athletics records ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1997 |World Indoor Championships |Paris, France |29th (q) |Long jump |7.26 m |- |Mediterranean Games |Bari, Italy |10th |Long jump |7.66 m |- |rowspan=2|1998 |African Championships |Dakar, Senegal |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Long jump |8.13 m |- |World Cup |Johannesburg, South Africa |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Long jump |8.26 mRepresenting Africa |- |rowspan=2|1999 |World Indoor Championships |Maebashi, Japan |10th |Long jump |7.66 m |- |All-Africa Games |Johannesburg, South Africa |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Long jump |8.09 m |- |2000 |African Championships |Algiers, Algeria |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Long jump |7.90 m |- |2002 |African Championships |Radès, Tunisia |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Long jump |8.02 m (w) |- |2004 |African Championships |Brazzaville, Republic of the Congo |4th |Long jump |7.68 m |- |2005 |Islamic Solidarity Games |Mecca, Saudi Arabia |6th |Long jump |7.71 m |- |2006 |African Championships |Bambous, Mauritius |10th |Long jump |7.51 m |- |rowspan=2|2007 |rowspan=2|Pan Arab Games |rowspan=2|Cairo, Egypt |4th |4 × 100 m relay |40.17 m (NR) |- |4th |Long jump |7.83 m |- |2008 |African Championships |Addis Ababa, Ethiopia |6th |Long jump |7.87 m |} ==References== * Category:1975 births Category:Living people Category:Egyptian male long jumpers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Egypt Category:African Games gold medalists for Egypt Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1999 All-Africa Games
title: Hatem Mersal
